messages.title: VOTE CONSERVATIVE â€“ TO GET GOOD REASONS TO
messages.content: 1) We will say no to a 3rd runway at Heathrow, 2) We will fight crime in our local area with street level policing, 3) We will back the NHS - the NHS is a top priority, 4) We will tackle poverty & get Britain working, 5) We will change politics and rebuild trust, 6) We will keep your council tax low, 7) We will make you feel safer, 8) We will continue to improve our environment, 9) We will increase recycling

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Conservative government would say no to a third runway at Heathrow.
We will continue to monitor CCTV 24/7 so that you feel safer on the streets.
A Conservative Government is committed to a National Health Service that is free and available to everyone in our society. We will increase spending each year.

We will act now to deal with the public spending deficit so that mortgage rates stay lower. We will concentrate benefit spending on the most vulnerable and will raise the basic state pension. We will abolish Stamp Duty for first time buyers, helping young people get into the property market.
A Conservative government would work to deliver essential with full transparency and integrity.
The Conservatives have frozen the council tax for four years running in the London Borough of Hounslow.
We will continue to monitor CCTV 24/7 to make you feel safer on the streets.
We will continue to improve and preserve our environment. As part of our plan to build greener communities, we promised to cut crime and have strong new laws.
We will increase the amount of waste that we recycle to 50% by 2014.

issues.economy: We will act now to deal with the public spending deficit so that mortgage rates stay lower.
issues.environment: We have extensive works taking place at the moment with more than a third of Hounslow's massive investment.
issues.governance: A Conservative government would work to deliver essential services with full transparency and integrity.
issues.health: A Conservative Government is committed to a National Health Service that is free and available to everyone in our society. We will increase spending each year.
issues.immigration: We will fight controlled immigration with a cap on numbers coming in.
issues.socialWelfare: We will concentrate benefit spending on the most vulnerable and will raise the basic state pension.

housing.content: We will abolish Stamp Duty for first time buyers, helping young people get into the property market.

politicalExperience.achievements: Talking to Grove Road Primary School in Hounslow about the Local Pimlico Academy on the Rugby.

images.caption: Mary Macleod discussing education at Grove Road Primary School.
Mary and Cllr Peter Thompson discussing concerns with Chiswick businesses.
Mary at a local Crime Summit with Cllr Thompson and Home Secretary Chris Grayling at Hounslow's Conservative crime survey.
Mary with stroke patient, David Mills, at the West Middlesex Hospital in Isleworth.
